name: Committing - One step at a time
description: Learn version control with tools like git and Github... Project collaboration wouldn't be easy without tools like this...
how_to_find_us: Enter a shuttle into UNILAG.  Its straight down the road opposite hydraulics. Ask for directions to computer science. The last building looking down is where E303 is located.

name: DevFest SW Nigeria 2017 - Ibadan

venue.name: The Great Hall - Nustreams Conference & Culture Centre
venue.address_1: Nustreams Conference & Culture Centre, 110, Abeokuta Road, Opp Alalubosa Estate GRA Extension, Ibadan

description:
Please register here: http://bit.ly/devfestsw17 as this is the official attendee list.

GDG South-West DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more! We will be having developers from all around the south-west region of Nigeria in one place to experience the best of Google technology.

Website: http://devfestsw.gdg.ng (http://devfestsw.gdg.ng/)

Collaborating GDGs: GDG Lagos, GDG FUNAAB, GDG OAU, GDG LAUTECH, GDG UNILAG, GDG Covenant University, GDG BELLS University, GDG Unilorin and GDG Osogbo

FAQs

1. Why do I have to register twice? - This is primarily because we are collaborating with other GDGs for this event so meetup is not sufficient for event registration.

2. If I RSVP on meetup do I still need to register on the Eventbrite page? - Yes, you need to register on Eventbrite. See 1 above.

3. Do I need to register for this event? - Yes, while it's a free event, registration is compulsory.

name: Introduction to Web Development 2017
description:
Introduction to Web development 2017 is an intensive 2 weeks training for new developers focused on ladies.

Event Agenda:

Session

Welcoming of guests and participants. - 10.00am – 10. 15am

Introduction of WTM Community - 10.15am – 10.20am

Lesson 1 - 10.20am – 11.00am

Lesson 2 - 11.00am – 11.45am

Break!!! Break!!! Break!!!

Lesson 3 - 12.20pm – 1.20pm

Announcement / Questions & Answers / 30 minutes Practice - 1.20pm – 1.30pm

Closing Remarks - 1.55pm – 2.00pm

name: CLoud Study Jam UNILAGüë®üèª‍üíªüë©üèΩ‍üíª
description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

• What to bring
Laptops [MAC, ChromeBooks, othersüòÅ],Laptop chargers, Extension.

• Important to know
Please have the latest Version of Chrome running on your laptop or Firefox Venue Details
- RM 256/263
Faculty of Engineering
Electrical and Electronic Department
UNILAG

name: IWD (International Women's Day) UNILAG 2018
description:
• What we'll do
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

International Women's Day is a global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural and political achievements of women. The day also marks a call to action for accelerating gender parity.
We are proud of the contributions women in technology have made across the world and this day is a moment to recognize their influence in the tech industry and beyond.

Overall objective of the event:
To bring to limelight reputable women, who don't normally get the spotlight but have done remarkable things in the tech world.
To motivate and encourage the younger ladies to aspire to be great women in tech.
To provide a platform for attendees to interact with reputable women in the tech industry.

Event Agenda

1. Doors Open, Registration

2. Welcome / Opening Remarks

3. Keynote

4. Panel

5. Local Demo

6. Lunch & Networking

7. Workshop Track 1: Code Lab: Android Things

Workshop Track 2: Speechless Workshop

8. Fireside Chat

9. Entertainment

10. Closing Remarks

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: DSC UNILAG PRE-HASHCODE WORKSHOP
description:
As promised, DSCUnilag is hosting a pre-hascode workshop to help participating teams understand the flow of the competition and how to interpret Google hashcode questions.

Date: February 8th 2019
Venue: LT009, Faculty of Science
Time: 10am - 1pm

üèÆInterested teams will be given an opportunity to prepare themselves ahead of the major qualification come February 28th 2019

We will be helping you with:
‚ô¶Surmounting the fears you may have about participating in the competition.

‚ô¶Tips and materials to be used in preparation for the event.

‚ô¶Hands on workshop on how to participate.

‚ô¶An opportunity to meet with other tech enthusiasts and form a team.

name: HASH CODE ‚ûï DSC UNILAG
description:
DSCUnilag will be hosting a hub üè¢ for the Online Qualification Round of Google Hash Code.

üíªüíª Hash Code is a team programming competition organized by Google. Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to Google’s office to compete in the Final Round of the competition in April.

üí¢Registered teams from Lagos are invited to participate from our hub.

The Online Qualification Round takes place.
üìÜ February 28th, 2019
üï° 6:30pm
üè¢ University of Lagos, Akoka.

If you’re interested in joining our hub:
‚ô¶ Find a team (2 to 4 people)
‚ô¶Register your team at g.co/hashcode.
‚ô¶ Select University of Lagos Developer Student Club Nigeria from the list of hubs in the Judge System.

üí¢ Need preparation materials? Use this - https://g.co/hashcode/archive

üí¢ We are planning a pre-competition meetup to explain the flow and how to interpret questions on January 30th, 2019.

Brought to you by DSC Unilag
